required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study to Evaluate the Effect of BYDUREON on 24-hour Glucose Control in Metformin Treated Patients With Type 2 Diabetes.
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized Double-blind, Parallel-group Study to Evaluate the Effect of BYDUREON Compared With Placebo on 24-hour Glucose Control in Metformin-treated Patients With Type 2 Diabetes

brief_summary.textblock: A Randomized, Double-blind, Parallel-group Study to Evaluate the Effect of Bydureon Compared with Placebo on 24-hour Glucose Control in Metformin-treated Patients with Type 2 Diabetes.

detailed_description.textblock: A Randomized, Double-blind, Parallel-group Study to Evaluate the Effect of Bydureon Compared with Placebo on 24-hour Glucose Control in 110 Metformin-treated Patients with Type 2 Diabetes

primary_outcome.description: Change in 24-hour mean weighted glucose from baseline (Day -1/1) to Day 6 of Week 4 (Day 27/28) and to Day 6 of Week 10 (Day 69/70).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in 24-hour Mean Weighted Glucose Between Day 1 of Week 10 (Day 64/65) and Day 6 of Week 10 (Day 69/70) Within Each EQW-treated Patient
Change From Baseline (Day1) to Day 70 and Day 22 in FPG
Change From Baseline (Day -1) to Day 64 and Day 22 in 2- Hour Mean Weighted PPG (After the Breakfast Meal)
Average of Change in 24-hour Mean Weighted Glucose From Baseline to Week 4 and Baseline to Week 10
Change in HbA1c From Baseline to Day 22 and Baseline to Day 70

intervention.description: Once weekly injection of 2mg bydureon (extended release exenatide) for 10 weeks.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Type 2 diabetes mellitus (T2DM) treated with stable dose of metformin > or = to 1500mg/day as monotherapy for at least 8 weeks
- Hemoglobin A1c (HbA1c) 7% to 10% at screening
- Body mass index (BMI) < or = to 45 kg/m2
Exclusion Criteria:
- History of taking antihyperglycemic therapy other than metformin or metformin extended release (XR) during the 8 weeks prior to screening
- History of taking a dipeptidyl peptidase-4 (DPP-4) inhibitor or pramlintide during 12 weeks prior to screening
- History of potent, inhaled or intrapulmonary steroids 3 months prior to screening or during the study
- History of prescription or over the counter weight loss medication during 3 months prior to screening
- Previous exposure to exenatide or any glucagon-like peptide-1 (GLP-1) receptor agonist during 6 months prior to screening

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: 239 subjects were screened in order to randomize 117 subjects; however, 116 subjects were included in the modified intent to treat population, which consisted of all randomized patients who received at least one dose of randomized study drug.

baseline.population: 239 subjects were screened in order to randomize 117 subjects; however, 116 subjects were included in the modified intent to treat population, which consisted of all randomized patients who received at least one dose of randomized study drug.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Institution & PI agree they will not use or disclose and confidential information to third parties for a period of 10 years from receipt.
